ygData.subject: Re: Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: I like cussing out my friends in lizard tongue... I make fun of elves in knoll...  =) but other than roleplay value..  I have no idea.
ygData.messageBody:
I like cussing out my friends in lizard tongue...
I make fun of elves in knoll... =)

but other than roleplay value.. I have no idea.

> ----------
> From: axiome7@...[SMTP:axiome7@...]
> Reply To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 10:39 AM
> To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Languages
>
> From: <axiome7@...>
>
> I wonder, what is the value of training in any of the "non-old" languages,
> such as gnoll and lizardman? Old Erudian and the other languages that might
> benefit us in spell research make sense. But if every creature speaks common
> at a minimum, why spend any time or practices learning these languages? I
> must be missing something.
>
> - Axiome (Bertxxx)
>
